intro: Carpesium ciliatum, commonly known as the hairy thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and features spiny leaves with fine, hairy textures. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing seeds that are dispersed by the wind. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
